name: DuckDuckGo News Tool
description: Call DuckDuckGo News API. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from typing import Union

from langchain_core.tools import Tool

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import SecretStrInput, MultilineInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class GoogleSearchAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name = "DuckDuckGo News API"
    description = "Call DuckDuckGo News API."
    name = "DuckDuckGoNewsAPI"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Search",
        )
    ]

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        results = wrapper.invoke(self.input_value)
        #print(50 * "#")
        #print(type(results))
        #print("debug print", results)
        #print(50 * "#")
        # Step 1: Split the string into individual entries based on "], [" which separates them
        entries = results.strip("[]").split("], [")
        
        # Step 2: Convert each entry into a dictionary
        results_converted = []
        for entry in entries:
            # Use regex to find all key-value pairs
            pairs = re.findall(r'(\w+):\s(.*?)(?=, \w+:|$)', entry)
            
            # Convert the list of pairs into a dictionary
            entry_dict = {key: value.strip() for key, value in pairs}
            
            # Append the dictionary to the converted list
            results_converted.append(entry_dict)
        #print(50 * "#")
        #print(type(results_converted))
        #print("debug print", results_converted)
        #print(50 * "#")
        data = [Data(data=result, text="{}, {}, {}".format(result["title"], result["snippet"], result["link"])) for result in results_converted]
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        return Tool(
            name="duckduckgo_news",
            description="DuckDuckGo for recent News.",
            func=wrapper.run,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        try:
            from langchain_community.tools import DuckDuckGoSearchResults  # type: ignore
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError("Please install duckduckgo-search to use DuckDuckGoSearchResults.")
        return DuckDuckGoSearchResults(backend="news")

from typing import Union

from langchain_core.tools import Tool

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import SecretStrInput, MultilineInput, IntInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class GoogleSearchAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name = "DuckDuckGo News API"
    description = "Call DuckDuckGo News API."
    name = "DuckDuckGoNewsAPI"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Search",
        )
    ]

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        results = wrapper.invoke(self.input_value)
        #print(50 * "#")
        #print(type(results))
        #print("debug print", results)
        #print(50 * "#")
        # Step 1: Split the string into individual entries based on "], [" which separates them
        entries = results.strip("[]").split("], [")
        
        # Step 2: Convert each entry into a dictionary
        results_converted = []
        for entry in entries:
            # Use regex to find all key-value pairs
            pairs = re.findall(r'(\w+):\s(.*?)(?=, \w+:|$)', entry)
            
            # Convert the list of pairs into a dictionary
            entry_dict = {key: value.strip() for key, value in pairs}
            
            # Append the dictionary to the converted list
            results_converted.append(entry_dict)
        #print(50 * "#")
        #print(type(results_converted))
        #print("debug print", results_converted)
        #print(50 * "#")
        data = [Data(data=result, text="{}, {}, {}".format(result["title"], result["snippet"], result["link"])) for result in results_converted]
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        return Tool(
            name="duckduckgo_news",
            description="DuckDuckGo for recent News.",
            func=wrapper.run,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        try:
            from langchain_community.tools import DuckDuckGoSearchResults  # type: ignore
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError("Please install duckduckgo-search to use DuckDuckGoSearchResults.")
        return DuckDuckGoSearchResults(backend="news")
